name: Taiyaki NYC Japanese Ice Cream
address: 119 Baxter St, New York, NY 10013, USA

reviews.text: Delicious every time.
Good place to try some unique ice-cream!

A mainstay of the chinatown dessert scene for YEARS. You canâ€™t go wrong getting anything here, and this order was ready in about 20 seconds. Pictured: Red bean Tayaki waffle cone with matcha ice cream, condensed milk, wafers, and mochi. $10
Good Japanese style ice cream dessert. They were having a special pumpkin flavor for all I am assuming. I liked it, you can taste the pumpkin flavor.
Super fast service. A good selection of flavors and topping.
Very good experience.  Very good ice cream and exceptional flavor cone.

Excellente glace goÃ»ts originaux
Fair.
Delicious ice cream in a cute ğŸ â€¦
Have to experience this at least once in your lifetime!
The Beach, Please was amazing
Just an american ice crean i fish shape waffle. The price doesn't match the product.
Amazing matcha ice cream, but not the best area in town to sit or walk unfortunately
Loved it, had the fish shaped ice cream cone with the green tea swirl ice cream. Worth the walk to try for sure!
Eminim kaliteli malzemeler kullanÄ±yorlardÄ±r ve yine eminim ki birÃ§ok insan lezzetli de buluyordur. Ancak, benim iÃ§in fazlasÄ±yla ÅŸekerli ve sÄ±radandÄ±.

We ordered the mini mochi taiyakis and they told us it was 7 minutes to make. We had to wait for 14 minutes, and when we got it, half of them were cold (not made fresh) and they only 8 instead of 9. It wouldnt make sense to wait again andâ€¦
AMAZING, the icecream was delicious, the beans in icecream was an intristingly good suprise, and the service was very nice
This is the best ice cream I have ever had! The flavors are so good and the cone is delicious!

I came to visit this spot only because they had the Japanese pancakes and taiyaki the taiyaki was really good but online they never said the pancakes would take 30 minutes just to make I been to other locations and the pancakes ever tookâ€¦
Cheap price and good quality. One of the best!
Nice place to get the ice cream in a hot day
Fresh and fast taiyaki ice cream and classic red bean treats. Nice staff, chill interior and close to plenty of restaurants.

Iâ€™ve tried a lot of taiyaki around the world. I ordered 2 taiyaki here, and theyâ€™re not great. Outside the taiyaki was not crispy at all, the bread was quite thick and there was no fillings in the tail part at all. Inside cream of taiyaki was ok. Maybe ice cream will be better.

Awful service, very disappointed!
We encountered an incredibly rude African-American woman who made us leave without making a purchase, even though we arrived earlier with two small kids to buy the exactly this ice cream. We drove to this location for 1.5 hours!
Delicious!!! 10/10

I've been here twice already. I love that they have fished shaped cones. I like the custard flavor better than their red bean flavor. I like the mango strawberry ice cream so I winded up getting it again. This time with my own options,â€¦
ice cream was mid tier good but workers were careless and extremely unprofessional. overpriced too, save your money.

I think this place is hyped too much. There isn't anything bad but the ice creams were average. It was well decorated but nothing worth gushing over. We thought the taiyaki were too soggy and smelled bad. We've had much better elsewhere.

Always so yummy, I get taiyaki with red bean sometimes with vanilla and chocolate ice cream and sometimes just matcha. The taiyaki tastes like cake. Everything just tastes really good and fresh. 10/10
muy rico helado super recomendado

These are so cute and a great way to beat the NY summers. I got the Matcha Better w/Taiyaki cone and it was so delicious. My partner created one of his own and also really enjoyed it. Not a bad price for the size of the Taiyaki and the amount of ice cream you receive. Will recommend to friends.

We stopped by Taiyaki NYC before exploring the Bowery graffiti, and it was such a fun treat! We tried the chocolate soft-serve with the custard-filled fish-shaped cones, and they were absolutely delicious. The cones were warm and fluffy,â€¦
Uma delicinha de sorvete. VÃ¡ se estiver na regiÃ£o.
Nothing special about the taste. Expensive ice cream just for Instagram photos.
One of my favorite spots to go to whenever I visit NYC! â¤ï¸

Our daughter loves coming to Taiyaki, the service is fast even when there is a bit of a queue and prices are very fair (I believe $8) for most of their offerings. I would recommend skipping the taiyaki mochi (fresh from the oven). Weâ€¦
I went to this place today and the place was so cute. This was my go to matcha place for a while. At the front desk, the person was rude. He did not even acknowledge me. He did notâ€¦
BalÄ±k ÅŸeklindeki kÃ¼lahlarÄ± ile Ã§ok gÃ¼zel bir lezzet. Ã‡ok beÄŸendim. â¤ï¸
Soft ans soggy
Tried 5 different cones. All was good. Yuzu/matcha was my favorite.
Great ice cream!

Eis war lecker
Taiyaki ganz ok
Great treat
Love this darling little spot. So different , whimsical and unique. I went and bought myself a taiyaki maker just because of this little spot.

Yet another Instagram friendly ice cream store. This time fish shaped cones being the draw filled with sticky red bean paste. Ice cream itself good rather than great. Space not very comfortable to sit in but it's a good area to stroll anyway.

My family and I stopped in to this ice cream shop because we wanted something sweet but different while we were visiting Chinatown in New York city. Everyone was very kind while serving us and the Japanese ice cream was uniquely delicious. The fish shaped cone had its own surprised at the very bottom, it was like some sort of custard but it was complimentary to the ice cream. There are a couple of benches for seating while you enjoy your ice cream, it is a small space but doable for about eight people all at once. There is no outside seating available. We would definitely recommend this buisness to anyone who enjoys ice cream because it's unique, delicious and flavorful.  Thank you for your kindness,  we wish you many years of success and hope to be back in town to enjoy more of your ice cream.

Such a fun and unique dessert experience! The taiyaki cone is warm, fluffy, and perfectly filled â€“ paired with creamy soft serve, itâ€™s a match made in heaven. I tried the matcha and vanilla swirl, and it was both rich and refreshing. Greatâ€¦
Insanely amazing

Ate too fast so don't have pictures of ice cream but we ordered one of a bunch, they look just like pictures, and tasted great!  Maybe biased because it was hot outside and this ice cream really hit the spot, but we thought this place was great!

Trendy shop in lower Manhattan. Small store front but really good ice cream, especially on a hot day. The wait isn't long and the staff works quickly. They have a ton of options to pick, and everyone seemed to love their flavor. Not over priced considering how popular they are.

Cool little spot in Chinatown to get ice cream treats in one of those cute 'fish shaped cone '. They don't have too many flavors but I got the chocolate tayaki cone with some chocolate syrup on top and a cookie added on top too . Reallyâ€¦

EstÃ¡vamos ali por Little Italy e Chinatown e eu havia visto as avaliaÃ§Ãµes desse local, que eram muito boas por sinal.
Ao chegar, vocÃª verÃ¡ que Ã© uma casa pequena e simples, mas nÃ£o desista de comer!!

O sorvete Ã© bem diferenciado, a â€œcasquinhaâ€ na verdade Ã© tipo uma panquequinha japonesa (meus pais inclusive fazem em casa e Ã© muuuuito boa!!!) nÃ£o Ã© uma casquinha simples, entÃ£o nÃ£o deixe de pedir!

Ã‰ uma supresa atrÃ¡s da outra!
Eu comi o de Matcha com Yuzu pra inovar! E nÃ£o me arrependi!!!!

Vale muito a pena se estiver ali pela regiÃ£o!

The hot weather is perfect for ice cream. I got the Matcha and Yuzu on a Taiyaki cone. The ice cream looks exactly the same as the advertised menu. The ice cream is soft, creamy, and not overly sweet. The are a few benches inside the storeâ€¦

Taiyaki is a super fun unique treat to enjoy when you're in Chinatown.
I got the mango & strawberry soft serve which is served in a red bean filled come and my friend got the macha & Yuzu which was topped with mochi and a wafer.
Both were super yummy and refreshing. I could definitely share one next time.

I was recommended the yuzu matcha taiyakiâ€”honestly wasnâ€™t sure how those flavors would go together, but it ended up being pretty decent. The taiyaki itself was super crispy, which I loved. Definitely worth a try if youâ€™re curious about unique flavor combos.

The ice cream is decent, but not memorable. I had expected the cone to be larger considering that the average price for a serving is over $9. Overall, the concept is very cute and aesthetic, but the food is nothing special. Would order again if I passed by.

Stopped by Taiyaki NYC and tried the Straight Out of Japan and the Beach, Please. The hojicha was smooth, toasty, and really enjoyable. The fruity flavor in the Beach, Please was refreshing and bright. The taiyaki cones added a fun andâ€¦
we went later in the day they were sold out of alot of the items. but the match and hojicha mix was really good. ğŸ”¥ğŸ”¥â€¦

A MUST GO! Best ice cream in the city. No matter what season it may be, Taiyaki is a top spot fro ice cream lovers. They need to come back to Miami.
5 stars for Teriyaki NYC

Food: 5 Stars
The ice cream is soft served on a delicious soft baked cone. I mean what more could you ask for? Oh yeah, how about chocolate drizzle and a wafer cookie to top it off. I went with a classic vanilla option and was so good that we went back for seconds and tried the Matcha flavor. Both were very good with Vanilla being my top choice.

Service: 5 Stars
Very friendly upon walking in and super helpful with any questions we had. They were even nice enough to provide samples to a few flavors before we committed to a choice.

Ambiance: 4 Stars
The ambiance is a typical ice cream shop. It is a very small location with a few seats but you're not coming here for ambiance. The best seat in the house is actually a step outside on the streets of NYC. Itâ€™s on a side street which isn't necessarily busy so you can take some awesome pictures with your delicious ice cream cones.

Unfortunately pretty mid, esp for $9. Chocolate ice cream is grainy. The cone is a cool idea, but barely had any custard and just felt sterile / pre packaged. Vanilla ice cream is good. You get so few rainbow mochi. The syrups are nothing special. Not really good seating.

Excellent spot for high quality taiyaki. Their ice cream flavors are delicious and there are many choices.

I appreciate how they have a few preset options you could choose and then a â€œmake your ownâ€ option as well. Theyâ€™re also super accommodating if you choose a preset one and change toppings - they donâ€™t charge you to change!

There is no space in the restaurant, and with how crowded it gets, youâ€™ll be standing next to a bunch of people.

There isnâ€™t any close seating, so be prepared to stand outside and eat.

åº—å†…ã¯ç‹­ã‚ã§ã—ãŸã€‚

I LOVED this place! Chinatown is known for holes in the wall so I didn't expect the storefront to look spectacular. It's certainly a gem you don't realize you step into unfortunately, around the area at the time of this riding there is a lot of construction blocking people knowing about it.

I will say, I am late to writing this review so I've already been to this place three times. That should proof that this place is legit because I definitely made this place a repeat business and brought friends with me.

I forgot the name of it, but it was the Choco some thing as you see pictured here, and it was so delightful. Total 5 stars from me!

Un sitio pequeÃ±o y escondido en el medio de China Town. Si te gusta este tipo de comida no te lo pierdas. Lo Ãºnico malo es que es muy pequeÃ±o y apenas tiene sitio,  pero te lo puedes llevar puesto...Jajajajajaja

Taiyaki NYC is an absolute gem! From the moment you step inside, you're greeted by the warm and inviting aroma of freshly made taiyaki. The soft, fish-shaped waffles filled with creamy, rich ice cream are nothing short of perfection. The combination of the warm, slightly crispy taiyaki with the cold, flavorful ice cream is a match made in dessert heaven.

The variety of flavors and toppings is impressive, offering something for everyone, whether you prefer traditional Japanese flavors like matcha and red bean or more classic tastes like vanilla and chocolate. The presentation is also Instagram-worthy, with every cone crafted to look as good as it tastes.

The staff is friendly and efficient, making the experience even more enjoyable. If you're looking for a unique and delicious treat, Taiyaki NYC is a must-visit. Highly recommended for anyone with a sweet tooth!

Delicious!! I got the traditional one with custard cream and one with red bean paste.
From the ice cream filled  i just took a lick it was very creamy great qualityâ€¦

At $9 a cone, honestly, I expected more. Surprised this place has so many reviews. Itâ€™s essentially McDonaldâ€™s soft serve ice cream with toppings. The waffle that acts as the cone is actually kind of good, but I personally would never come back here.

I ordered the classic, my wife built her own.,

Delicious soft-serve ice cream with spongy fish cones. There are many flavors to choose from and many toppings as well, it can get overwhelming at first but the staff is dope and will help you every step of the way. I got the strawberryâ€¦

After having Taiyaki from a different store in San Jose, we were excited to come here in New York.

We came here twice. The first time we got the unicorn specialty Taiyaki. We enjoyed it, but I have to say I was a little disappointed in their flavors. The only filling options were custard and red bean paste. The ice cream flavor options seemed more American tailored (strawberry, mango, etc).

We had heard a lot about the souflee pancakes, but we didn't realize they only have them Friday-Sunday from 11am-2pm. We came back the next day to get them.

They were amazing. The were huge fluffy pancakes. I'm not a huge pancake fan, but these light fluffy pancakes were great. I would definitely come back for these.

I think this place is definitely worth a stop while in NYC.

A very unique experience here. You cannot go wrong with any flavor here. We got the chocolate this time and it was delicious and the waffle was perfectly crispy and doughy inside.

The staff is extremely polite and very friendly and the store is super clean. They accept credit cards, which is a plus.

Omg was the ice cream amazing. Really the best I ever eat. When you want the toast of japan, you have to go there. But you need time because a lot of people want to go there. It is one a little store.

I have been seeing pictures of this place all over my instagram so I thought why not and let me tell you, I was not disappointed. The soft serve comes in different shape of cone and tastes really good. We ordered straight out of Japan and beach please. Both were really good.

Taiyaki NYC offers some of the most unique and delicious Japanese ice cream in the city! The soft serve in the fish-shaped cone is both Instagram-worthy and incredibly tasty. The flavors are rich, and the toppings are a fun, creative touch. However, at $9, itâ€™s a bit on the pricey side for a dessert. While itâ€™s a splurge, the experience is definitely worth it, especially if youâ€™re looking to treat yourself to something special. Just be prepared for the price tag. Overall, a delightful and memorable experience!

Overrated, IMO. We arrived 1h before they close, but there was already nothing available except for 1 ice cream flavorâ€¦?! The guy at the cashier gave the vibes that we annoy him with our presence a bitâ€¦lol
The ice cream was really mid. Not sure why it has such high rating. Would not recommend

I was invited to an event here and I didnâ€™t know what to expect. These ice cream fish cones are too good to be true: delicious and cute! I was overwhelmed with the flavors because I wanted to try them all. The ice cream specialist offered samples to try various soft serve flavors and explained how each tasted. It was a plus to have the staff be knowledgable because certain days you are in the mood for something sweet, tarty or chocolate-y. I ordered the Straight Outta Japan, a matcha and hojicha ice cream swirl, simple yet packed with a bang. I was debating between that one and the  Unicorn Tyaika, but opted for a simpler version. This means I am definitely come back to stay cool for the next coming summer months. I am so happy I chose such the swirl because it was delicious! It wasnâ€™t too sweet at all and the surprise at the end is the read bean as you take the bite out of the fish cone. What a fun combination of matcha, hojicha and red bean. The accruements of rainbow mocha and wafer stick was icing on the cake.

A variety of adorable original delicious creations, in a shop that's also adorable (the store front was cute with a classic design, and the interior clean with  a modern layout), staffed by people that were friendly :)
We tried several of the flavors, and you basically can't go wrong, my favorite was chocolate, take a look at the photos for the designs

Would go again when I visit NYC

The ice cream is good! I like the matcha and yuzu combo I got. I like the size being so small and consumable and I donâ€™t feel heavy after eating and still have room for other stuff later. The red bean cone is so yummy and the red bean pasteâ€¦
Ice cream good but overrated. Total $10.50. Overall 7/10. I'd probably prefer a pint of Ben and Jerry's.

Loved this place more than I expected. I didn't think it would actually taste as good as it looked, but surprisingly, it did. It's a really smart but practical idea to turn two of my favourite desserts into one!
